books.title: Mansfield Park (Penguin Classics)
books.author: Austen, Jane
books.review: Finished 3/20/2008 - Was motivated to read this story after seeing the recent Masterpiece Theatre treatment on PBS.  I liked it.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice (Bantam Classics)
books.author: Austen, Jane
books.review: Read 3/1/2008 - Tough to beat.  We always enjoy watching a 6-hour marathon of the A&E mini-series with Jennifer Ehle and Colin Firth - a very honest adaptation of the book.

books.title: The Turk: The Life and Times of the Famous Eighteenth-Century Chess-Playing Machine
books.author: Standage, Tom
books.review: Read early 2008 - An interesting story, but I think it could have been the subject of a 25-page paper rather than a full-length book.

books.title: Bobby Fischer Goes to War: How A Lone American Star Defeated the Soviet Chess Machine (P.S.)
books.author: Edmonds, David
books.review: Read Early 2008 - Shortly after Fischer's death in early 2008, I was motivated to read this book.  I remembered the news reports I heard as a child, but didn't really understand the larger context.  There was plenty of context supplied here, but I personally would have liked more focus on the chess games themselves.  Still, it held some interest.

books.title: Genome..the Autobiography of a Species in 23 Chapters
books.author: Ridley, Matt
